paper_abstract: For a simple digraph G, let beta(G) be the size of the smallest subset X subset of E(G) such that G - X has no directed cycles, and let gamma(G) be the number of unordered pairs of nonadjacent vertices in G. A digraph G is called m-free if G has no directed cycles of length at most m. This paper proves that beta(G) <= 1/m-2 gamma(G) for any m-free digraph G, which generalizes some known results. (c) 2013 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.
paper_title: Minimum feedback arc set of m-free digraphs
